title.rendered: 5 Habits That May Shorten Your Lash Extensions’ Life Expectancy

content.rendered:
Lash extensions are one of the easiest ways for a woman to get that extra bit of glam that she’s always craved. They add fullness, length, and a dramatic flair to any look, and can simplify almost any beauty routine. Naturally, we all want our lash extensions to last for as long as possible, so that those benefits continue. To ensure that longevity, though, you need to avoid habits and behaviors that might threaten those delicate lashes. Here are five of those habits, and why you should avoid them.

Rubbing Your Eyes

We all do it from time to time. Our eyes get tired and we react by rubbing them with our hands. Unfortunately, that rubbing can play havoc with your extensions. Remember, one of the most basic elements of extension aftercare is to never pull on your lashes. Well, rubbing has much the same impact on those extensions. Simply put, avoid it all costs.

Using a Blow Dryer

If you use a blow dryer, it’s important to know how to do so without damaging your lashes. There are only three options available: use a relatively cool setting to save the extensions from that heat, angle the dryer away from lashes at all times, or let your hair dry naturally.

Spending Time in the Sauna

If the heat from a blow dryer can uncurl your lashes, what do you think the heat from a steamy-hot sauna can do? That’s right: all that steam has the potential to weaken the adhesive bond that holds your extensions in place. Before you know it, you could be looking at a costly set of disconnected lash extensions! Our advice: find another way to open those pores.

Using a Tanning Bed

Women who tan often face similar challenges, especially if they use tanning beds. The focused heat can weaken lash curl, and potentially weaken the adhesive. The good news is that you can avoid this effect by wearing goggles. And yes, in case you were wondering, that goes for spray tans too. Goggles are your extensions’ best friend.

Applying and Removing Mascara

So, you paid for a new set of lash extensions, sat in the salon for an hour or so, and you are still applying mascara every day? While you can get away with using some mascara products, let’s be clear: with a great set of eyelash extensions, you don’t need mascara. But if you absolutely must wear it, choose a water-based product and exercise great care during both the application and removal process.

Bad habits are hard to break, but your lash extensions are counting on you to make the right choices. At Ebenezer Eyelash, we’re here to help too, with the information and professional lash extension applications you need to give yourself the perfect lashes you’ve been dreaming about. To discover more about the best lash extension services in New York City, or to schedule your next appointment for perfect lashes, give us a call today.
